q: Never argue with stupid people, they will drag you down to their level and then beat you with experience.
h:
“Never argue with stupid people, they will drag you down to their level and then beat you with experience.” —
Mark Twain

q: Don't seek, don't avoid, don't expect. Take what comes and be happy.
h:
“Don't seek, don't avoid, don't expect. Take what comes and be happy.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: To injure an opponent is to injure yourself. To control aggression without inflicting injury is the Art of Peace.
h:
“To injure an opponent is to injure yourself. To control aggression without inflicting injury is the Art of Peace.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: Every person, all the events of your life are there because you have drawn them there. What you choose to do with them is up to you.
h:
“Every person, all the events of your life are there because you have drawn them there. What you choose to do with them is up to you.” —
Richard Bach

q: The chief cause of failure and unhappiness is trading what you want most for what you want right now.
h:
“The chief cause of failure and unhappiness is trading what you want most for what you want right now.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: If you want to achieve greatness stop asking for permission.
h:
“If you want to achieve greatness stop asking for permission.” —
Unknown

q: The world is changed by your example, not by your opinion.
h:
“The world is changed by your example, not by your opinion.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: Don't gain the world and lose your soul. Wisdom is better than silver and gold.
h:
“Don't gain the world and lose your soul. Wisdom is better than silver and gold.” —
Bob Marley

q: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
h:
“First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.” —
Epictetus

q: Misfortune shows those who are not really friends.
h:
“Misfortune shows those who are not really friends.” —
Aristotle

q: The best way to understanding is a few good examples.
h:
“The best way to understanding is a few good examples.” —
Isaac Newton

q: Love is the absence of judgment.
h:
“Love is the absence of judgment.” —
Dalai Lama

q: Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.
h:
“Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.” —
Abraham Lincoln

q: The more something scares you, the more you should do it.
h:
“The more something scares you, the more you should do it.” —
Mark Manson

q: Life has more imagination than we carry in our dreams.
h:
“Life has more imagination than we carry in our dreams.” —
Christopher Columbus

q: Don't want anything. Then you get everything.
h:
“Don't want anything. Then you get everything.” —
Seungsahn

q: Happiness can be found, even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.
h:
“Happiness can be found, even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.” —
Albus Dumbledore

q: It's not how much money you make, it's how much money you keep.
h:
“It's not how much money you make, it's how much money you keep.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: You cannot swim for new horizons until you have courage to lose sight of the shore.
h:
“You cannot swim for new horizons until you have courage to lose sight of the shore.” —
William Faulkner

q: We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give.
h:
“We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give.” —
Unknown

q: Life is one long process of getting tired.
h:
“Life is one long process of getting tired.” —
Samuel Butler

q: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
h:
“Believe you can and you're halfway there.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: He who is not contented with what he has, would not be contented with what he would like to have.
h:
“He who is not contented with what he has, would not be contented with what he would like to have.” —
Socrates

q: Singleness of purpose is one of the chief essentials for success in life, no matter what may be one's aim.
h:
“Singleness of purpose is one of the chief essentials for success in life, no matter what may be one's aim.” —
John D. Rockefeller

q: The size of your success is measured by the strength of your desire; the size of your dream; and how you handle disappointment along the way.
h:
“The size of your success is measured by the strength of your desire; the size of your dream; and how you handle disappointment along the way.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: Be courteous to all, but intimate with few, and let those few be well tried before you give them your confidence.
h:
“Be courteous to all, but intimate with few, and let those few be well tried before you give them your confidence. ” —
George Washington

q: Words are the clothing of our thoughts.
h:
“Words are the clothing of our thoughts.” —
Jonathan Swift

q: He who has overcome his fears will truly be free.
h:
“He who has overcome his fears will truly be free.” —
Aristotle

q: If you want to achieve anything in this world, you have to get used to the idea that not everyone will like you.
h:
“If you want to achieve anything in this world, you have to get used to the idea that not everyone will like you.” —
Simon Sinek

q: The moment you doubt whether you can fly, you cease for ever to be able to do it.
h:
“The moment you doubt whether you can fly, you cease for ever to be able to do it.” —
James Matthew Barrie

q: Peace is not something you wish for; It's something you make, something you do, something you are, and something you give away.
h:
“Peace is not something you wish for; It's something you make, something you do, something you are, and something you give away.” —
John Lennon

q: Boldness makes even the smallest animal dangerous.
h:
“Boldness makes even the smallest animal dangerous.” —
Robert Greene

q: Constantly seek criticism. A well thought out critique of whatever you're doing is as valuable as gold.
h:
“Constantly seek criticism. A well thought out critique of whatever you're doing is as valuable as gold.” —
Elon Musk

q: What is planted in each person's soul will sprout.
h:
“What is planted in each person's soul will sprout. ” —
Rumi

q: Silence is a source of great strength.
h:
“Silence is a source of great strength.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Every man is guilty of all the good he did not do.
h:
“Every man is guilty of all the good he did not do. ” —
Voltaire

q: One must be deeply aware of the impermanence of the world.
h:
“One must be deeply aware of the impermanence of the world.” —
Dogen

q: Everything has its beauty, but not everyone sees it.
h:
“Everything has its beauty, but not everyone sees it. ” —
Confucius

q: Art is the signature of civilizations.
h:
“Art is the signature of civilizations. ” —
Beverly Sills

q: A man with outward courage dares to die: a man with inner courage dares to live.
h:
“A man with outward courage dares to die: a man with inner courage dares to live.” —
Lao Tzu

q: You are the only real obstacle in your path to a fulfilling life.
h:
“You are the only real obstacle in your path to a fulfilling life.” —
Les Brown

q: TEAMWORK: the fuel that allows common people attain uncommon results.
h:
“TEAMWORK: the fuel that allows common people attain uncommon results.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: Everything you've ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
h:
“Everything you've ever wanted is on the other side of fear.” —
Brian Tracy

q: When you rise in the morning, form a resolution to make the day a happy one for a fellow creature.
h:
“When you rise in the morning, form a resolution to make the day a happy one for a fellow creature.” —
Sydney Smith

q: Judge a man by his questions rather than his answers.
h:
“Judge a man by his questions rather than his answers.” —
Voltaire

q: All cruelty springs from weakness.
h:
“All cruelty springs from weakness. ” —
Seneca

q: I discovered a long time ago that if I helped enough people get what they wanted, I would always get what I wanted and I would never have to worry.
h:
“I discovered a long time ago that if I helped enough people get what they wanted, I would always get what I wanted and I would never have to worry.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance you must keep moving.
h:
“Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance you must keep moving.” —
Albert Einstein

q: Because a thing seems difficult for you, do not think it impossible.
h:
“Because a thing seems difficult for you, do not think it impossible.” —
Marcus Aurelius

q: Our happiness depends on the habit of mind we cultivate.
h:
“Our happiness depends on the habit of mind we cultivate.” —
Norman Vincent Peale
